Material used.Description: Human neuroblastoma M17 cells were cultured in Ham's F-12 high glucose Dulbecco's modified Eagle's medium containing Eagle's Minimum Essential Medium supplemented with 10% fetal bovine serum, L-glutamine, non-essential amino acids, sodium pyruvate and penicillin-streptomycin.

Readout description.Result Description: A30P mutant a-synuclein displayed remarkable resistance to HO-1-induced proteosomal degradation, with levels remaining at 95-110% of basal levels even with increasing HO-1 expression.
A53T mutant a-synuclein did not significantly affect degradation in HO-1 over-expressing cells, with levels reduced to 10.8% of mock-transfected cells, similar to wild-type.
E46K mutation was mentioned but not specifically tested for proteosomal degradation in this study.

Biological replicates.Description: Experiments were performed with multiple transfections and treatments, indicating biological replicates.

Technical replicates.Description: No specific mention of technical replicates in the literature.

Basic positive control.Description: Wild-type a-synuclein was used as a positive control for degradation comparison.

Basic negative control.Description: Mock-transfected cells or sham-transfected cells were used as negative controls.

Statistical analysis method.Statistical analysis method: One-way ANOVA followed by Newman-Keuls post hoc comparisons to assess significant main effects within groups. Statistical significance was set at p < 0.05.

Threshold for normal readout.Threshold for normal readout: Protein levels similar to or greater than 80% of basal levels in mock-transfected cells.

Threshold for abnormal readout.Threshold for abnormal readout: Protein levels less than 50% of basal levels in mock-transfected cells or resistance to degradation.

Material used.Description: Cells were lysed in 20 mM Tris-HCl (pH 7.4) containing 0.25 M sucrose and protease inhibitor cocktail, sonicated on ice and centrifuged for 20 min at 4°C at 15 000 g.

Readout description.Result Description: A30P mutation did not interfere with HO activity in cells, with activity levels similar to wild-type at 2.4 nmoles of bilirubin/mg/min.
A53T mutation was not specifically tested for effects on HO enzyme activity in this study.
E46K mutation was not specifically tested for effects on HO enzyme activity in this study.

Biological replicates.Description: Multiple cell extracts and treatments were used, indicating biological replicates.

Technical replicates.Description: No specific mention of technical replicates in the literature.

Basic positive control.Description: HO-1-transfected cells without inhibitors were used as positive controls for activity.

Basic negative control.Description: Mock-transfected cells were used as negative controls showing basal HO activity.

Statistical analysis method.Statistical analysis method: One-way ANOVA followed by Newman-Keuls post hoc comparisons to assess significant main effects within groups. Statistical significance was set at p < 0.05.

Threshold for normal readout.Threshold for normal readout: HO activity levels similar to or greater than 2.8-fold of basal levels in mock-transfected cells.

Threshold for abnormal readout.Threshold for abnormal readout: HO activity levels close to basal levels in mock-transfected cells despite HO-1 transfection.

Material used.Description: Cells seeded in 96-well plate and transfected with indicated plasmid DNA were incubated with MTT reagent at 37°C for 2 h.

Readout description.Result Description: The proportion of live cells in A30P transfected cultures was 95% of that computed in the WT-transfected cells, indicating no significant toxicity.
A53T mutation was not specifically tested for cell survival effects in this study.
E46K mutation was not specifically tested for cell survival effects in this study.

Biological replicates.Description: Multiple wells and transfections were used, indicating biological replicates.

Technical replicates.Description: No specific mention of technical replicates in the literature.

Basic positive control.Description: Wild-type a-synuclein transfected cells were used as positive controls for survival.

Basic negative control.Description: No specific negative control mentioned for MTT assay.

Statistical analysis method.Statistical analysis method: One-way ANOVA followed by Newman-Keuls post hoc comparisons to assess significant main effects within groups. Statistical significance was set at p < 0.05.

Threshold for normal readout.Threshold for normal readout: Cell survival rate greater than 90% of wild-type transfected cells.

Threshold for abnormal readout.Threshold for abnormal readout: Cell survival rate less than 70% of wild-type transfected cells.
